edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.core.datastructures.textannotation

Class AbstractTextAnnotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.core.datastructures.textannotation.AbstractTextAnnotation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sentence, TextAnnotation

    public abstract class AbstractTextAnnotation
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This is the abstract class that represents annotation for text -- this could represent a paragraph or just a sentence.

    This class stores the raw text, the tokens and the list of views available for the text and provides methods for adding new views.

    Author:
    Vivek Srikumar
    See Also:
    TextAnnotation, Sentence, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • text

        public String text
        The raw text

      • tokens

        protected String[] tokens
        The list of tokens in the text. This might be a contentious issue because different annotators might use different tokenization schemes. One way to fix that would be to use some sort of common subsequence finding algorithm to align the tokenization to the canonical one.

      • tokenCharacterOffsets

        protected IntPair[] tokenCharacterOffsets
        The character offsets of the tokens.

      • views

        protected Map<String,List<View>> views
        The list of views

        The tokenized text

      • hasView

        public boolean hasView(String viewName)
        Checks if this text annotation has a view identified by viewName
        Returns:
        true if the text annotation contains a view called viewName and false otherwise

      • setTokens

        public void setTokens(String[] tokens,
                      IntPair[] tokenCharacterOffsets)
        Deprecated. There is now a TOKENS view that should be used to access the tokens
        Set the tokens for this text.

        NOTE: This function should not be called by any method that is not a Tokenizer and will throw an exception if tokens are set more than once. So do not call this function unless you know what you are doing.

        Parameters:
        tokens - An array of tokens
        tokenCharacterOffsets - An array, whose length is the same as tokens. Each element indicates the character offset of this token in the raw text.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the tokens are set more than once.

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the number of tokens in this text.
        Returns:
        the number of tokens

      • select

        public IQueryable<Constituent> select(String viewName)
        Gets a queryable list of all constituents from the view, represented by viewName. This function can be used for SQL-like queries on the text.

        Examples: In all the examples that follow, we assume that text is a variable of type AbstractTextAnnotation.

        1. Given a constituent srlConstituent from the SRL_VERB view, find all constituents in the parse view that cover exactly this constituent. 

           List<Constituent> parseConstituent = text.select(ViewNames.PARSE).where(
         Queries.sameSpanAsConstituent(srlConstituent));

        See Also:
        QueryableList, ViewNames
